unit_learning_outcomes.description: Identify sub-cellular compartments in neurons and how they are involved in the regulation of neuronal function.
Explain pathomechanisms in the injured and diseased nervous system at a cellular level.
Describe experimental techniques for studying of cell function in the nervous system.
Explain the structure and function of neurons and non-neuronal cells of the nervous system.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Reading of original research and review articles
Preparation of Lecture, Practical and Tutorial material

enrolment_rules.description: COGS100 or COGS1000 or HLTH108 or ANAT1001 or BIOL115 or BIOL1110

assessments.description: Formal exam, assessing all unit content [short answers and MCQs], held in the Uni exam period
Critical Review and Synthesis of Research Topic
In-class quizzes, assessing unit content, delivered to this point, using online MCQs, conducted under exam conditions

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances, North Ryde

school.value: Faculty of Medicine, Health and Human Sciences

data.description: In the first part of this unit you will cover various topics, including the morphogenesis and function of neurons and glial cells in the peripheral and central nervous system. A particular emphasis will be the discussion of the structure and function of specialised micro-compartments in neuronal cells, the generation of electrical signals in neurons, the structure, properties and function of ion channels, receptors and transporters and chemical transmission of signals at nerve cell connections. In the second part of this unit, you will focus  on how neuronal function is disrupted in disease and which technologies are available to interrogate functional aspects of the nervous system under physiological conditions and in the diseased nervous system. This will include an in depth discussion of modern experimental technologies in cellular physiology as well as the application of molecular biology techniques to manipulate and explore the function of molecules in the nervous system.
data.title: Cellular and Molecular Neuroscience

title: Cellular and Molecular Neuroscience
